The claim of: health care premiums up 90 percent in New Hampshire" was made in an ad released by the free-market group Americans For Prosperity, which targeted Sen. Jeanne Shaheen for her support of President Obama's health care law.
The claim was also made in a press relea: which described Obamacare as an "unmitigated disaster" that is raising the cost of health care for the middle class.
The Morgan Stanley study: which the claim is based on, only looked at individual and small-group rate increases, excluding large-group plans, which are the most commonly held form of insurance.
The methodology of the Morgan Stanley st: as it surveyed only 148 insurance brokers nationally, with only one from New Hampshire, and the survey results were not made available to the New Hampshire Department of Insurance.
